test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime1args-1
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = xs:dateTime(lower bound)

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime1args-2
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = xs:dateTime(mid range)

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime1args-3
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = xs:dateTime(upper bound)

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-1
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function As per example 1 of the F&O specs.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-2
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as an argument to an "avg" function.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-3
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function involving a "numeric-less-than" operation (lt operator)

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-4
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function involving a "numeric-less-than" operation (le operator)

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-5
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function using the empty sequence as an argument. Use count function to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-6
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function that returns 0.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-7
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function that returns 59.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-8
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "+" expression.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-9
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "-" expression.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-10
test-case.description: Evaluates The "secondss-from-dateTime" function as part of a "*" expression.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-11
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "div" expression.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-12
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "idiv" expression.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-13
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "mod" expression.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-14
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "numeric-unary-plus" expression.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-15
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "numeric-unary-minus" expression.

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-16
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "numeric-equal" expression (eq operator)

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-17
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "numeric-equal" expression (ne operator)

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-18
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "numeric-equal" expression (le operator)

test-case.name: fn-seconds-from-dateTime-19
test-case.description: Evaluates The "seconds-from-dateTime" function as part of a "numeric-equal" expression (ge operator)

test-case.name: K-SecondsFromDateTimeFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `seconds-from-dateTime()`.

test-case.name: K-SecondsFromDateTimeFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `seconds-from-dateTime((), "Wrong param")`.

test-case.name: K-SecondsFromDateTimeFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(seconds-from-dateTime(()))`.

test-case.name: K-SecondsFromDateTimeFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `seconds-from-dateTime(()) instance of xs:decimal?`.

test-case.name: K-SecondsFromDateTimeFunc-5
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `seconds-from-dateTime(xs:dateTime("2001-02-03T08:23:12.43")) eq 12.43`.
